title: Inflation data collection
summary: Measures of inflation data, including CPI, RPI, CPIH and RPIJ

breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Economy
breadcrumb.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.

breadcrumb.title: Inflation and price indices
breadcrumb.summary: Inflation measures the rate of increase in prices for goods and services using price indices. The rate of inflation used in the UK governmentâ€™s inflation target is measured using the Consumer Prices Index (CPI). One way to understand the CPI is to think of a very large shopping basket containing a large selection of the goods and services bought by households, the CPI estimates changes to the total cost of this basket.
